newsitem.title: CANADA: Edper plans merger with Brascan.
newsitem.headline: Edper plans merger with Brascan.

text.p: Edper Group Ltd and Brascan Ltd said on Tuesday that they intend to combine the two companies into a new company called Edper Brascan Corp.
The two companies said current holders of Edper class A and B limited voting shares will continue to own the same number of class A and B shares of the combined company.

It said current holders of Brascan class A shares will receive 1.5 class A limited voting shares in Edper Brascan for each Brascan share. Convertible debenture and preferred shareholders of Edper and Brascan will continue to hold equivalent securities of the combined company.
Edper and Brascan said the new enterprise will continue the present dividend policy of Edper paying quarterly dividends totalling C$0.98 a share annually.

The companies said in a statement that following the combination Edper class A shareholders will own 54 percent of the class A shares of the combined company on a fully diluted basis, with the remaining 46 percent owned by the current public shareholders of Brascan.
Under the new structure, Edper Chairman Timothy Price will become the Chairman of Trilon. Robert Harding, President and Chief Executive Officer of Edper, will become Chairman of Edper Brascan Corp.

Trevor Eyton, current Chairman of Brascan will become Senior Chairman of Edper Brascan. Jack Cockwell, current President and Chief Executive of Brascan, will hold the same titles in the newly-merged company.
